newsitem.title: USA: CME lumber touch limit down, set new contract lows.
newsitem.headline: CME lumber touch limit down, set new contract lows.

text.p: CME lumber futures tumbled for limit losses of $10.00 per tbf in September and November and posted new contract lows in both months and March as slow cash trade continued to press the market, traders said.

Sell stops were triggered, accelerating the drop. September fell for a limit loss and new low of $332.00 and November $332.60 before some short covering pared losses. At 1057 CDT, futures stood $9.50 to $6.50 lower with September off $8.80 at $333.20 and November off most at $333.10 per tb.
